greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of initial subtrees (subtrees emanating from the root) of the unlabeled rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number n.
comment: We require that an initial subtree contain either all or none of the branchings under any given node.
formula: a(1) = 1 and if n > 1 has prime factorization n = prime(x_1)^y_1 * ... * prime(x_k)^y_k then a(n) = 1 + a(x_1)^y_1 * ... * a(x_k)^y_k.
example: 70 is the Matula-Goebel number of the tree (o((o))(oo)), which has 7 distinct initial subtrees: {o, (ooo), (oo(oo)), (o(o)o), (o(o)(oo)), (o((o))o), (o((o))(oo))}. So a(70) = 7.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 13 2018
